Description: Most of Attic pottery red-figured squat lekythos with palmette design, reconstructed from several fragments, neck and mouth missing. Glazed save for palmette at front.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
On vase, remains of a modern sticker with number ending in 33. Found together in one tomb with Boston MFA P.5716 (=RES.87.162), P.5717 (=88.819) and P.5718 (=RES.87.163).
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 237, no. 233)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1956)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5715 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
